Choices for Hospital.country

class wp4.locations.models.Hospital(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Simple helper class to hold information related to the various project and non-project locations. Currently referenced from Donor, OrganAllocation, RetrievalTeam, and StaffPerson

Parameters:
  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – “ID”
  • created_on (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “created on”
  • created_by_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “created by” - User account for the person logged in when this record was made/updated
  • version (django.db.models.PositiveIntegerField) – “version” - Internal tracking version number
  • record_locked (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “record locked” - Not presently implemented or used
  • name (django.db.models.CharField) – “HO01 hospital name”
  • country (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “HO02 country”
  • is_active (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “HO03 is active” - Not presently used/implemented. For legacy data when a location closes for use
  • is_project_site (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “HO04 is project site”
full_description¶
get_absolute_url()[source]¶
exception DoesNotExist¶
exception Hospital.MultipleObjectsReturned¶
Hospital.created_by¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Hospital.donor_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.
